citeinfo.origin: Center for Interdisciplinary Geospatial Information Technologies, Delta State University (Data provider)
citeinfo.title: NATIONAL_GRID_1000M_IN: The 1000-meter U.S. National Grid (1000 m x 1000 m) for Indiana (Delta State University, Polygon Shapefile)

pubinfo.publish: Center for Interdisciplinary Geospatial Information Technologies, Delta State University

citeinfo.othercit:
A source shapefile named "IN_USNG_UTM16.SHP" was downloaded by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) from the following web page hosted by the Center for Interdisciplinary Geospatial Information Technologies, Delta State University, on November 8, 2012: http://mississippi.deltastate.edu/
Users of these data may wish to read the Adobe PDF document named "USNGInfoSheetsCv5_4pages.pdf" found at the following Web address for further information about using the grid and locating and obtaining precise values: http://www.fgdc.gov/usng/USNGInfoSheetsCv5_4pages.pdf

descript.abstract:
This data set shows the Indiana-portion of the 1000-meter United States National Grid (USNG).
The following is excerpted from metadata provided with the original source data set named "IN_USNG_UTM16.SHP":
"This is a polygon feature data layer of United States National Grid (1000 m x 1000 m polygons) constructed by the Center for Interdisciplinary Geospatial Information Technologies at Delta State University with support from the US Geological Survey under the Cooperative Agreement 07ERAG0083. For correct display, please set the base coordinate system and projection such that it matches the UTM zone for which these data were constructed using the NAD 83 datum. Further information about the US National Grid is available from http://www.fgdc.gov/usng and a viewing of these layers as applied to local geography may be seen at the National Map, http://www.nationalmap.gov ."
descript.purpose:
The United States National Grid (USNG) establishes a nationally consistent grid reference system (or "language of location"), and is intended to support emergency response, the general public, and commercial activities. It provides a grid reference system that is seemless across jurisdictional boundaries and is the foundation for a universal base map index. Using the USNG provides an unambiguous way to describe locations where users are operating in areas away from established road networks, or in areas affected by natural disasters where roads and/or road signs have been destroyed.
The following is excerpted from metadata provided with the original source data set named "IN_USNG_UTM16.SHP":
"The purpose of this data layer is to enable and promote the use of US National Grid as an 'attributed polygon overlay' over other feature data layers in paper and digital maps."

theme.themekey: Center for Interdisciplinary Geospatial Information Technologies, Delta State University

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Enterprise, Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 10.0 (Build 3200, Service Pack 2), Approximately 27.1 Mb

attracc.attraccr: There was no information provided in the metadata that accompanied the source shapefile named "IN_USNG_UTM16.SHP" pertaining to attribute accuracy. All attributes are assumed to be correct.

dataqual.logic: There was no information provided in the metadata that accompanied the source shapefile named "IN_USNG_UTM16.SHP" pertaining to logical consistancy, but is assumed to be topologically correct.
dataqual.complete: There was no information provided in the metadata that accompanied the source shapefile named "IN_USNG_UTM16.SHP" pertaining to completeness, but is assumed to be complete.

horizpa.horizpar: Accuracy is no better than that of the source shapefile named "IN_USNG_UTM16.SHP".

vertacc.vertaccr: Vertical accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of the data set.

citeinfo.origin: Center for Interdisciplinary Geospatial Information Technologies, Delta State University
citeinfo.title: IN_USNG_UTM16.SHP

pubinfo.publish: Center for Interdisciplinary Geospatial Information Technologies, Delta State University

srcinfo.srccontr: The Indiana portion of the U.S. National Grid (USNG), a 1000-meter locational reference grid

procstep.procdesc: An ESRI shapefile named "IN_USNG_UTM16.SHP" was downloaded by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) on November 8, 2012, from the following Web site: http://mississippi.deltastate.edu/ . The shapefile was opened in ESRI ArcGIS 10.0 for visual inspection and to validate the projected coordinate system of UTM Zone 16, NAD 1983. It was then renamed as "NATIONAL_GRID_1000M_IN.SHP" to conform to internal naming conventions of the IGS.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attr.attrdef: USNG Grid Zone Designator (GZD) values for Indiana
attr.attrdefs: Center for Interdisciplinary Geospatial Information Technologies, Delta State University

edom.edomvd: Indiana falls within the 16th Longitudinal Zone. The southern portion of Indiana (south of the 40th degree latitude line) falls within the UTM zone designated as "S" (defined as the zone between the 32nd and 40th degrees of latitude).

Indiana falls within the 16th Longitudinal Zone. The northern portion of Indiana (north of the 40th degree latitude line) falls within the UTM zone designated as "T" (defined as the zone between the 40th and 48th degrees of latitude).

attr.attrdef: Unique two digit character ID values for each 100,000-meter USNG Square
attr.attrdefs: Center for Interdisciplinary Geospatial Information Technologies, Delta State University

attr.attrdef: Lower left Eastings values of each 1000-meter USNG Grid Box (thought of as the X-axis value)
attr.attrdefs: Center for Interdisciplinary Geospatial Information Technologies, Delta State University

attr.attrdef: Lower left Northings values of each 1000-meter USNG Grid Box (thought of as the Y-axis value)
attr.attrdefs: Center for Interdisciplinary Geospatial Information Technologies, Delta State University

attr.attrdef: The fully qualified USNG coordinate describing the lower left corner of a 1000-m x 1000-m polygon (area), (for example: a value of "16S EJ 5053" consists of the GRID1MIL value, then the Grid100K value, then the two digit Eastings Value is combined with the two digit Northings value).
attr.attrdefs: Center for Interdisciplinary Geospatial Information Technologies, Delta State University

distinfo.distliab:
CREDIT:
It is requested that the Indiana Geological Survey be cited in any products generated from this data. The following source citation should be included: [NATIONAL_GRID_1000M_IN: The 1000-meter U.S. National Grid (1000 m x 1000 m) for Indiana (Delta State University, Polygon Shapefile)].

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It is not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
